p: In the study performed by Maia and Andrade in 2007 [ 17] with the essential oil of Z. monogynum, from different regions, the composition of each of them is described: In one of the major compounds was the oils citronellal (57.1%), limonene (13.8%), citronellyl acetate (13.1%), and citronellol (6.2%). In the other, the main compounds were 2-undecanone (70.2%) and citronellal (22.5%). It is believed that this difference in composition might be related to the use of leaves from two chemotypes of Zanthoxylum monogynum. Additionally, some factors can affect this difference in composition such as geographical locations, environment, and stage of maturity [ 21].
